document_data.caption: A map of Moray showing Dynnegall on the shore of Lac Dynnegall.
document_data.name: Dynnegall
document_data.mainbody: '''Dynnegall''' was a small village located on the isle of [[Moray]] within the [[Moonshae Isles]].{{Cite dungeon/196/Backdrop: The Moonshae Isles}}
document_data.Geography: The village was located in north central Moray along the northeast shore of [[Lac Dynnegall]], {{SI|15|mi|k|long=yes}} south of [[Caer Moray]].
document_data.History:
Dynnagall was named for a former king of the island. The village's location on the lake and near the [[Breasal Marsh]] provided it with an excellent source of peat for heating and of [[kryne]], a nutritious plant.{{Cite dungeon/196/Backdrop: The Moonshae Isles|10}}

The village had a bloody history, having been completely wiped out several times by monsters. Attacks from the [[Black Blood Tribe]] occurred several times per year. Soldiers stationed here often came away with many stories of their heroics, assuming they survived.
